GET /api.description: Returns a JSON object listing all available API endpoints with their descriptions.

GET /api/topics.description: Returns an array of topic objects.

GET /api/users.description: Returns an array of user objects, each containing the properties: username, name, and avatar_url.

GET /api/users/:username.description: Returns a user object corresponding to the specified username.

GET /api/users/me.description: Returns the current authenticated user's information. Requires valid JWT token via cookie or Authorisation header.

GET /api/articles.description: Returns a paginated array of article objects. Each object includes comment_count and excludes the body field. Supports sorting, ordering, topic filtering, and pagination via query parameters.

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: Returns a single article object, specified by article_id. Includes a comment_count property.

article.title: Running a Node App
article.author: grumpy19
article.body: This is part two of a series on how to get up and running with Systemd and Node.js. This part dives deeper into how to successfully run your app with systemd long-term, and how to set it up in a production environment.

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Returns a paginated array of comment objects for the specified article_id, sorted by created_at in descending order. Supports pagination via limit and p query parameters.

POST /api/articles.description: Creates a new article. Accepts an object with author, title, body, topic, and optionally article_img_url. Returns the created article including comment_count set to 0.

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Creates a new comment on the specified article. Requires username and body. Returns the created comment object.

POST /api/topics.description: Creates a new topic. Accepts an object with slug, description, and img_url. Returns the created topic object.

POST /api/auth/register.description: Registers a new user. Accepts a username, name, email, password, and optional avatar_url. If avatar_url is not provided, a default profile image is used.

POST /api/auth/login.description: Logs a user in using their email and password. Sets a token cookie and returns the user object (excluding password hash).

POST /api/auth/logout.description: Logs a user out by clearing the authentication token cookie.

PATCH /api/auth/:username/password.description: Updates a user's password. Requires the new password in the request body.

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: Updates the vote count of the specified article by the value provided in inc_votes. Returns the updated article.

article.author: butter_bridge

PATCH /api/comments/:comment_id.description: Updates the vote count of the specified comment by the value provided in inc_votes. Returns the updated comment.

DELETE /api/articles/:article_id.description: Deletes the specified article and its associated comments. Returns 204 with no content.

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: Deletes the specified comment. Returns 204 with no content.

POST /api/users/:username/avatar.description: Uploads a new avatar image for the specified user. Accepts multipart/form-data with a single 'avatar' file field. Returns the updated avatar_url.
